nodes.bodyText:
requirements and, => requirements, and
I saw that Ashwin used an attribute for a placeholder for "Pantheon". Should we all be doing that?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+ifdef::context[:parent-context: {context}]
+
+include::../attributes.adoc[]
+
+[id="help"]
+= Help
+
+:context: assembly-pantheon-help
+
+Welcome to Pantheon help.
+
+This document describes the main concepts, requirements and, actions in Pantheon.

nodes.bodyText:
Changed as requested.
In regards to the use of attributes, it probably makes sense to do so, and I've updated all references to 'Pantheon' to use the attribute version instead. I've also added this to our review issues.
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText: I believe Ingrid guides us to avoid intro sentences like this that don't really add any value.

nodes.bodyText:
Maybe just make the section heading more descriptive and get rid of this sentence?
== Concepts => == Pantheon Concepts
